thread.title: Why wasn’t baseball this indignant when Holliday took out Giants’ Scutaro in 2012?
thread.title_full: Why wasn’t baseball this indignant when Holliday took out Giants’ Scutaro in 2012? - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Henry Schulman
title: Why wasn’t baseball this indignant when Holliday took out Giants’ Scutaro in 2012?
text:
Photo: Beck Diefenbach, Special To The Chronicle Giants' third baseman Marco Scutaro grimaces after Cardinals' left fielder Matt Holliday slides into him on a fielder's choice out in the first inning during game 2 of the NLCS on Monday, Oct. 15, 2012 at AT&T Park in San Francisco, Calif. Giants' third baseman Marco Scutaro grimaces after Cardinals' left...
Somewhere in Florida, where he continues to work daily to strengthen his back and hip, Marco Scutaro must have watched Chase Utley's leg-breaking takeout slide on Ruben Tejada on Saturday night, heard that Utley was suspended for two games and said, "Hey, what about Matt Holliday?" Giants' third baseman Marco Scutaro grimaces after Cardinals' left fielder Matt Holliday slides into him on a fielder's choice out in the first inning during game 2 of the NLCS on Monday, Oct. 15, 2012 at AT&T Park in San Francisco, Calif. Giants' third baseman Marco Scutaro grimaces after Cardinals' left...
Somewhere in Florida, where he continues to work daily to strengthen his back and hip, Marco Scutaro must have watched Chase Utley's leg-breaking takeout slide on Ruben Tejada on Saturday night, heard that Utley was suspended for two games and said, "Hey, what about Matt Holliday?"
